factDescription: I'm a fast and dedicated learner with cross-disciplinary talents. I love being able to use my knowledge and experience to creatively and productively take on new projects and challenges. Here are some things I like to put my time into.

facts.name: Study
facts.description: A 20-year old 3A Software Engineer studying at the University of Waterloo.

facts.name: Code
facts.description: I love building clean and structured websites and games. I use JavaScript, C#, Lua, Java, C++, C, Ruby.

facts.name: Game Dev
facts.description: Ultra-passionate indie game developer. I've used Unity, Love2D, libGDX and am learning everyday.

facts.name: Music
facts.description: I'm a perfect-pitch pianist/guitarist with years of practice and compose music, as well.

facts.name: Art
facts.description: I love to draw digitally in my spare time. I've made artwork of all kinds and sold some at conventions.

tasks: Used C# and UGUI extensively to build game features for a beta launch
Wrote and merged 130 Unity and Rails pull requests in 15 weeks
Used internal frameworks to record user activity for analytic purposes
jobs.comment: Over the course of David's work term he has been a dependable worker that has been willing to take on difficult problems. I've been impressed with his ability to learn quickly and be able to work in areas without much prior knowledge of how they work. It's been a pleasure working with David, we wish him all the best.

tasks: Implemented client SockJS push notifications for Kik Points
Added automated UI tests using Selenium, WebDriverIO, PhantomJS
Designed and built user invite interface using Sketch 3
jobs.comment: David was amazing. He showed a great aptitude for learning and was a productive member of the team. By the end of the term he performed tasks that would otherwise have been worked on by senior members of the team.

tasks: Performed smoke and regression tests across many client environments

projectDescription: Creative and technical contributions and responsibilities are valuable to me when working on projects in teams, as well as independently. Likewise, I love hackathons, game jams, and simply building things in my own free time. Here's just a little bit of what I've been working on.

projects.title: My Website
projects.desc: Designed vertically and mobile-friendly, this website shows off my abilities and interests. Redesigned in 2016 using React.

projects.title: Acrodog
projects.desc: 2-day project for Ludum Dare 34. Help your stunt dog stay in the spotlight in this charming 2-button action game.

projects.title: Scorched
projects.desc: A fast-paced arcade game where the player tries to survive waves of molten monsters! In development.

projects.title: Translate
projects.desc: A Cardboard project for Hack the North 2015 that translates written foreign text in real-time.

projects.title: Space Golf
projects.desc: Unity game developed in 4 days as a bootcamp project at Uken Games. Brings golf to a solar system with tricky orbitals.

projects.title: Keytar
projects.desc: A virtual keyboard Chrome extension that types using a guitar and microphone. EngHack Spring 2015 2nd place winner.

projects.title: Sushi Ninja
projects.desc: Multiplayer sushi-grabbing, ninja-dashing game made for GI Jam of Spring 2015. Won prize for most polished and completed!

projects.title: Sun Slayer
projects.desc: 2-day project for Ludum Dare 32, themed around unconventional weapons. Play as a fire hydrant and extinguish the sun.

projects.title: Hop Potato
projects.desc: Multiplayer party game that brings 8 players together in an intense, frantic game of hot potato. Winner of Kik Hack Week 15.04.

projects.title: Filespace
projects.desc: Webapp that aggregates online file storages like Dropbox and Drive. Built at Hack Western 2015.

projects.title: The Resistance
projects.desc: Top-10 EngHack Winter 2015 project. Helper webapp for 'The Resistance', eliminating physical boards, cards, and counters.

projects.title: Match 3
projects.desc: Top-3 Kik hackathon project. Enter a game room and compete in real-time to find matching patterns!

projects.title: Gardineering
projects.desc: 2-player turn-based strategy game at the Winter 2015 GI Jam. Compete to grow, water, and cut trees on a shared land.

projects.title: Little UFO
projects.desc: Control a UFO in a randomly generated terrain and abduct various objects that respond to physics.

projects.title: Smash Tracker
projects.desc: Simple Rails webapp to store, search, and compare Super Smash Bros. 1-on-1 match and player records.

projects.title: Fiery Flight
projects.desc: Winner of the Fall 2014 GI Jam Player's Choice. Work together with mouse and keyboard to chase your fiery nemesis!

projects.title: Wordasm
projects.desc: Player compete in real-time to build words using jumbled letters. Hack the North 2014.

projects.title: Mineral Miner
projects.desc: A puzzle game that challenges players to navigate, match, and collect gems on a grid.
